0.41.text: Why do we eat Roast Potatoes at Christmas?

21.41.text: It's because of a chap called sir Walter Raleigh

23.98.text: He wore a silly ruff that looks rather similar. It actually looked nothing like this... and a hat that was completely dissimilar to this

30.02.text: So, Sir Walter his sole job in the world was to basically annoy the Spanish

34.60.text: but also to go out there and find places for England. We like to find places back then.

38.78.text: and who was he finding it for? He was finding it for this lovely lady

42.66.text: Good Queen Bess. Elizabeth the 1st to you and I

45.28.text: Sir Walter, whilst off going to fin these things. Dear old Wally we do love him.

52.14.text: He didn't actually discover it. Well he found it for Britain, but the Spanish had probably

56.20.text: found them before us hence 'Patatas' and all that sort of stuff.

58.73.text: and also the fact that potatoes had been cultivated in South America

62.17.text:
since about 8000 BC. So why did the
potato become so popular?

it was still Sir Walter who gave it to

sadly he had his head cut off for various
